meanings.definition: A life-sized model of the human body used for displaying clothes.
meanings.sent1: The store used a mannequin to show off the new dress collection.
meanings.sent2: The mannequin in the window displayed the latest fashion trends.
meanings.sent3: The mannequin suddenly started dancing, surprising the customers.
meanings.sent4: Her stillness made her seem like a mannequin in a display window.
meanings.sent5: The mannequin's pose was so realistic that it almost looked like a real person.

meanings.definition: A person who is very thin or has an unnatural appearance.
meanings.sent1: She felt like a mannequin compared to her friends who were taller.
meanings.sent2: The model's slender figure made her look like a mannequin.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he must be a mannequin since he never gained weight.
meanings.sent4: Her pale skin and delicate features gave her a mannequin-like appearance.
meanings.sent5: The mannequin-like figure of the actress made her stand out on the red carpet.
